New Records: Emmanuel Clase picked up his league-leading 45th save, a career high, moving one save closer to the Guardians’ single-season record of 46 held by Jose Mesa (1995).
It was Cleveland’s 12th shutout win, and marked the 55th time the Guardians bullpen tossed at least three shutout innings in a game, the most in baseball.
Key Match Events: Brayan Rocchio blooped an RBI single into right field in the second inning.
Ben Lively tossed five efficient innings, holding the Rays scoreless on just 59 pitches.
Emmanuel Clase picked up his league-leading 45th save with a 1-2-3 ninth inning.
Angel Martinez scored from third after José Ramírez drew a throw to second base.
Post-Match Reflections: Brayan Rocchio commented on his bunt attempt, saying, 'I wanted to get the run in, and then I switched my mind and tried to hit the ball in the air.'
Guardians manager Stephen Vogt praised Rocchio, saying, 'He seems to come up with big hits... He is learning and he’s continuing to develop into an unbelievable major league shortstop.'
Ben Lively reflected on his performance, stating, 'It’s just about digging deep... Just trying to get everything right at the right time.'
Vogt praised Cade Smith’s work ethic, saying, 'We have a ton of detailed, hardworking people on our team, and I think Cade might be number one.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Guardians reduced their magic number to clinch the American League Central Division to 9 over the Royals.
Cleveland moved closer to securing a playoff spot, with a magic number of 4 over Detroit and Seattle.
José Ramírez extended his on-base streak to 14 games and his hitting streak to 8 games.
